alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 10:15AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND GUSTY CONDITIONS POSSIBLE THROUGH WEDNESDAY... A circulation, JTWC Invest 93W, is now located west of the Marianas near 15N144E. Heavy showers and a few thunderstorms extend from near the center to the east of the Marianas within a generally southerly flow. Overnight scatterometry data indicated stronger southeast winds of around 25 mph across the far northern Mariana Islands. This feature is being monitored by the Joint Typhoon Warning Center for gradual development as it heads northwestward and away from the Marianas the next several days. Computer model guidance continues to show the potential for heavy rainfall through Wednesday as a moist and unsettled southerly flow remains in place over the Marianas. The higher potential appears to be from Rota northward where 4 to 6 inches of rain are possible. Additionally, winds are expected to increase to between 15 and 20 mph tonight and Wednesday with gusts nearer heavy showers reaching close to 30 mph. Seas, currently between 3 and 5 feet, will become choppy at times in response to the increasing winds and could increase to between 6 and 8 feet by Wednesday, especially across the northern islands. Folks in the Marianas should keep up to date with the latest statements and advisories from the National Weather Service and your local emergency management offices. Forecast products issued by the National Weather Service are posted on the WFO Guam web page at www.weather.gov/gum.
